decks.notes: The main concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to aggressively attack the opponent with low-cost creatures like Rakdos Cackler, Burning-Tree Emissary, and Ash Zealot, supported by burn spells like Lightning Strike and Boros Charm. The deck also includes powerful cards like Boros Reckoner and Fanatic of Mogis for additional damage. The combination of creatures and burn spells aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly and efficiently. The deck relies on early aggression and consistent damage to win the game before the opponent can stabilize.

The focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays centered around devotion to black mana. By utilizing cards like Desecration Demon, Pack Rat, and Gray Merchant of Asphodel, the deck aims to quickly deplete the opponent's resources and deal significant damage. The inclusion of cards like Whip of Erebos and Underworld Connections provides additional utility and staying power. Thoughtseize and removal spells like Hero's Downfall help control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan, allowing the deck to maintain its aggressive momentum.

The deck focuses on aggressively building up devotion to black with cards like Gray Merchant of Asphodel and Nightveil Specter to fuel powerful black spells and abilities. With a strong removal package and card draw engines like Underworld Connections, the deck aims to control the board while chipping away at the opponent's life total with creatures like Pack Rat and Desecration Demon. Whip of Erebos provides additional recursion and lifegain, while cards like Thoughtseize and Hero's Downfall disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly and efficiently with its powerful black cards.

This deck focuses on aggressively maximizing the devotion to Black in order to trigger powerful effects from cards like Gray Merchant of Asphodel and Erebos, God of the Dead. By flooding the board with black permanents and utilizing cards like Pack Rat and Desecration Demon, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and drain their resources. Thoughtseize and Hero's Downfall provide disruption and removal, while Underworld Connections ensures a steady stream of card advantage. Overall, the deck aims to quickly establish control and pressure the opponent into defeat.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with low-cost creatures and disruptive spells, while leveraging the power of Thassa, God of the Sea for scrying and making creatures unblockable. The synergy between Master of Waves and the other elemental creatures creates a strong board presence, while Mutavault provides additional utility as a creature land. Cyclonic Rift and Rapid Hybridization offer removal options, and Bident of Thassa can help sustain card advantage. Overall, the goal is to maintain pressure and tempo to secure a swift victory through aggressive plays.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly establish a board presence with low-cost creatures and use them in combination with powerful spells and abilities to overwhelm the opponent. The deck includes cards that can generate additional mana, control the opponent's creatures, and draw additional cards. By utilizing cards like Thassa, God of the Sea and Master of Waves, the deck aims to maintain pressure on the opponent and secure victory by attacking with a combination of creatures and evasive abilities.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive red creatures and spells, while utilizing devotion to red mana for powerful effects. The deck includes a combination of powerful red creatures such as Stormbreath Dragon and Boros Reckoner, alongside support cards like Chained to the Rocks and Mizzium Mortars for removal. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Purphoros, God of the Forge and Nykthos, Shrine to Nyx to take advantage of the high number of red symbols in the deck for extra damage and mana ramp.

The main idea of this deck is to ramp up your mana quickly using green mana dorks and Nykthos, Shrine to Nyx, in order to play powerful creatures and spells faster than your opponent can react. The deck aims to control the game by casting big threats like Polukranos, World Eater and Mistcutter Hydra while also utilizing cards like Garruk, Caller of Beasts and Prime Speaker Zegana for card advantage. The inclusion of Cyclonic Rift helps to clear the board of any threats from the opponent, allowing you to maintain control and secure victory.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells, removal spells, and powerful planeswalker abilities. By utilizing cards like Detention Sphere and Supreme Verdict to handle threats, along with Jace, Architect of Thought and Elspeth, Sun's Champion to generate card advantage and board presence, the deck aims to outlast the opponent and win in the late game with a massive Sphinx's Revelation. The combination of control elements, card advantage, and win conditions like Aetherling make it a formidable opponent in any match.

This Naya Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming opponents with aggressive creatures and enchantments that provide additional benefits. The key strategy is to efficiently boost your creatures' power and toughness while also dealing direct damage to your opponent. By utilizing a combination of enchantments like Ethereal Armor and Madcap Skills, along with powerful creatures like Ghor-Clan Rampager and Voice of Resurgence, this deck aims to apply relentless pressure and outpace the opponent in terms of board presence and damage output. The deck also includes versatile spells like Boros Charm and Selesnya Charm to provide additional utility and protection.

The focus of this Orzhov Control deck is to establish board presence and disrupt the opponent's strategy through a combination of creature removal, hand disruption, and lifelink abilities. The deck utilizes powerful creatures like Desecration Demon and Blood Baron of Vizkopa along with key spells such as Thoughtseize and Hero's Downfall to control the game. The inclusion of lifelink cards like Whip of Erebos and Blood Baron of Vizkopa helps to stabilize the player's life total and maintain control over the match. Ultimately, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and secure victory through attrition.

The main focus of this deck is to establish board control and outvalue your opponent through powerful creatures and removal spells. By utilizing cards like Desecration Demon, Pack Rat, and Blood Baron of Vizkopa, along with a suite of removal spells like Hero's Downfall and Devour Flesh, you can dictate the pace of the game and disrupt your opponent's plans. The deck also includes card advantage engines like Underworld Connections to ensure that you never run out of resources. Through a combination of threats and answers, you aim to grind your opponent out of the game and emerge victorious.

The main concept of this deck is to establish control over the game by using a combination of removal spells, hand disruption, and powerful creatures. This Orzhov Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Thoughtseize and Hero's Downfall, while also providing a strong board presence with creatures like Desecration Demon and Blood Baron of Vizkopa. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent through card advantage and efficient removal, ultimately leading to victory through attrition. It also includes some lifegain and card draw options to help stabilize the board and outlast aggressive decks.

The main idea of this Orzhov Control deck is to focus on disruption and removal spells to control the opponent's board. Utilizing cards like Thoughtseize and Duress to strip away key cards from the opponent's hand, while using removal spells like Hero's Downfall and Devour Flesh to deal with threats on the battlefield. Additionally, the deck includes powerful finishers like Pack Rat, Blood Baron of Vizkopa, and Desecration Demon to close out the game. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent and maintain board control throughout the game.

This deck focuses on stalling the game and controlling the board with counterspells, removal, and card draw. The key strategy is to use powerful control cards like Detention Sphere and Supreme Verdict to answer threats, while using Jace, Architect of Thought and Sphinx's Revelation to maintain card advantage. Elspeth, Sun's Champion and Aetherling provide win conditions once the opponent's resources have been depleted. The deck aims to outlast opponents and overwhelm them with powerful cards in the late game.
